body_html:
Sorry just noticed this issue when doing a clean up of XLA issues.

Are you saying 1.3 is the preferred behavior while master branch is a regression? I'm actually not sure why that worked in 1.3 at all : There was an assert that prevents fused_batchnorm inference from being used and 7359fec fixed that (7359fec#diff-0edeb6b6a649db8138c4dd53d8ba0ed0L42).

Plus, from the graph you sent out, constant folding should be able to precompute all the nodes, so I don't think there will be a perf regression.

(Feel free to reopen the issue if you have more questions)

body:
Sorry just noticed this issue when doing a clean up of XLA issues. 

Are you saying 1.3 is the preferred behavior while master branch is a regression? I'm actually not sure why that worked in 1.3 at all : There was an assert that prevents fused_batchnorm inference from being used and 7359fec fixed that (https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/commit/7359fec792e4efec1670a12332bb524a5608b215#diff-0edeb6b6a649db8138c4dd53d8ba0ed0L42).

Plus, from the graph you sent out, constant folding should be able to precompute all the nodes, so I don't think there will be a perf regression. 

(Feel free to reopen the issue if you have more questions)
